column4: I have grub. This was installed from Wubi. When i type 'boot' after loading the kernel, it says "No filesystem could mount root. tried ext4, ext2, ext4, fusebkl.. Kernel panic - not syncing: VFS: Unable to mount root fs unknown-block(8,1)
And then it hits kernel panic.
You need to provide a proper root= kernel parameter, but why are you needing to boot from the grub shell? Do you not see a menu at boot?

i get my "Choose windows XP or ubuntu" menu.. then i choose Ubuntu and i quickly see loads of crap errors then it boots me into a grub shell. FYI i done a kernel upgrade today via ubuntu system upgrade and upon reboot this is where i'm at.
